section.section: There is an Investment Division in the State Retirement Agency.

Subject to paragraph (3) of this subsection, the Board of Trustees shall determine the qualifications and compensation for the following positions within the Investment Division:
deputy chief investment officer; and
managing director.

text.section: As the Board of Trustees specifies, the Investment Division shall invest the assets of the several systems.

section.section: Quarterly, the Investment Division shall submit to the Board of Trustees a report about the commissions that the State Retirement Agency pays on investments.

text.section:
On behalf of the several systems, the Chief Investment Officer:
may hire external investment managers to invest the assets of the several systems;
may select and invest in specific investment vehicles, including limited partnerships, private equity fund investments, and private real estate fund investments; and
may terminate the appointment of an external investment manager.

Prior to terminating the appointment of an external investment manager under subsection (d)(2) of this section, the Chief Investment Officer shall provide written documentation to the Board of Trustees and the Investment Committee explaining the basis for the termination.
